txt.en: DNT - Blah!
Beregond and his family sit at Pippin's table with a number of Gondorian nobles.
DNT - Blah!
He hands you a number of wine bottles to use as a peace offering
Listen to Merry and Pippin's account of the various courses
Listen (again) to Thrymm's tale of his exploits
'Peregrin Took!'
Listen to the conversation of Beregond's family
'Indeed, Grimbeorn!'
'Of course, courtesy demands one attend the ceremony before one attends the feast.'
'And you have missed the ceremony.'
Follow Merethien
The ceremony may be over, but the festivities continue! The great wedding-feast will last well into the night, with the noise of celebration continuing nearly until dawn.
'What...?'
'What is this?'
'Hullo there!'
'Ham, pea, and leek varieties!'
'With butter and honey!'
'Assorted greens and vegetables.'
'Coney, venison, AND boar!'
'Savory pies and pastries.'
'Beef, mutton, and goat!'
'Cheeses and olives.'
'Salmon, pike, and eel!'
'Stewed fruits.'
'Capon, goose, duck, pheasant, and heron!'
'The desserts have been particularly good.'
'Just like grandma used to boil!'
'And that is not to mention the wine and the ale.'
'If you've still got room!'
'To answer your question, Master Foodmonger, I would say this is quite the banquet, and we hobbits heartily approve!'
'[placeholder], I think we should see to Thrymm Red-beard.
'His listeners appear in need of rescue.'
'Look who it is, Pip! [placeholder], and our friend the foodmonger!'
'Come along, Thrymm! Someone at another table wishes to hear of your grand adventures.'
'I thought to ask for her hand in marriage, but I am full of worry.'
'Just listen to what we've had already!'
'Is it just this Midsummer's Day that makes me dwell upon it?'
'There has been pottage.'
'What if she does not feel the same as I?'
'Breads.'
'You need not apologize, dear Samwise.'
'Plenty of game.'
'I see.'
'Roasted meats.'
'I think I understand your advice, Master Samwise, and I thank you for your hobbit-wisdom!'
'Lots of fish.'
'I shall ask for Éowyn's hand when next I see her!'
'Enough fowl for all.'
'Oh, that's easy, it's...'
'Eggs if you want them.'
'What am I seeing?'
'The kitchens have been kept busy for days!'
'If such a feast in the Shire is commonplace, that must be a land of plenty!'
'Well, my hobbit friends! Does this \qbanquet\q of Gondor meet your expectations?'
'I am pleased... and a little exhausted... to hear it!'
'Enjoy yourselves, my friends.'
'This is very interesting, but -'
'Is every man of Rohan so bold, and yet so protected by fortunate stars?'
'I might have heard more of Éomer, father.'
'What is this?'
'Pippin!'
'Be careful, [placeholder]. They are gathered outside, right through those doors.'
'What is that?'
'Begging your pardon, Prince Faramir. I am sorry, for I hate to intrude...'
'Well, it seems to me that folk of Gondor always make things too complicated.'
'And maybe that's fine and normal down here...'
'...but in the Shire we prize when things are simple.'
'It's true that there's a lot of marriage talk in the air...'
'...and it makes me blush to think of it, since I never thought myself the type...'
'...but I am rather of a mind to get married myself, when this is all over.'
'Take a deep breath, my friend.'
'Welcome back, Master Peregrin. And greetings to you, [placeholder].'
'All will be well.'
'I know, my dearest. I know.'
'Now, is there a problem?'
'Still, the King's justice...'
'Ah, now I see.'
'Bergil, silence. This is not the time to speak of it.'
'It is a pleasure to meet you at last, Grimbeorn!'
'Find a table to your liking and food will be brought with all haste.'
'Ah, who desires to hear such?'
Talk to the wine steward
'Master Meriadoc, wait!'
Talk to King Elessar upstairs, on the western side of the feast-hall
Instance: The Wedding Banquet
'But one of the archers recognized me by the spectre of my beard!'
Talk to Prince Faramir of Ithilien
'Let me start over. We received the call to the weapontake on March 11th...'
Talk to Samwise Gamgee
Investigate the disturbance on the western side of the feast-hall
Talk to Grimbeorn
Talk to King Elessar
Kitchen-master
'Gondor has its King and its Queen.'
Listen (again) to Thrymm's tale of his exploits
Talk to Prince Imrahil
Talk to the wine steward downstairs
Go outside and confront the 'rough sorts' described by the wine steward
Listen to the words of the Grey Company
Talk to Radanir
Talk to Culang
Go back inside Merethrond and rejoin the wedding-feast
'They just barged in, my king! They are causing a commotion in the kitchens!'
'And so what if I do, Mister Frodo?'
'In the darkness of night, we came to the western flank of the encampment in the Drúadan.'
'And do you know what happened?'
'We were nearly turned into pincushions by Grimbold's sentries!'
'Can you imagine?'
'But THEN!'
'At the last moment, one of the archers recognized me by the spectre of my beard!'
'It glowed crimson in the guttering light of their single torch!'
'Many, aye! But even I am no match for Éomer who is now king!'
'The tales I could tell you of his courage!'
'Go, Pippin, go! Ha ha!'
'Do you have a particular girl in mind, Sam? I wager you do!'
The Grey Company has gathered to celebrate the wedding of their chieftain, and to honour the great deeds done on his behalf.

'Dear me! I am pleased that Prince Faramir has made up his mind, but to be completely honest with you, [placeholder], I had not quite gotten around to the advice I intended to give to him!\n\n'Still, all is well when it ends well... which it will, if Lady Éowyn agrees to his proposal. If she does not, I fear the reputation of hobbit-wisdom may suffer in Ithilien and Gondor! Oh dear!'
'Look, mother!'
Samwise Gamgee is at the head table in Merethrond.
'My husband grieves still for the lives he took.'
'I have told him again and again that by his sword he saved the life of Lord Faramir.'
Talk to Merry
'Was merciful, and fair.'
'I think it is lovely.'
'How beautiful a Queen this Elf-maiden makes!'
Follow Pippin back to his table
Talk to Beregond
Talk to Thrymm Red-beard
'I cannot believe my eyes!'
Wine Steward
'I'm bored.'
'For how long will they dance? Is it almost over?'
'I heard her brothers' arrows can split an Orc-skull in twain from three hundred yards!'
'I know! That's why I'm bored!'
'Ooooh!'
Talk to Merethien
'You owe me a drink or three, [placeholder].'
'But we got to talking...'
'And my companions thought you deserved the honour of a raised glass.'
'Quiet.'
'To the Grey Company! And to [placeholder]!'
'I'm told there was to be a feast.'
'Hmmmph. One wedding is much the same as any other.'
Grimbeorn's Dog
'Is there a place for me?'
'Good.'
'Well, in time of war, I myself have -'
'I need no servants. I have brought my own.'
'You will have to thank your Halfling friend for us, [placeholder].'
'This way!'
'That reminds me, [placeholder], I was given a message for you.'
Thrymm Red-beard has obtained a captive audience, and is regaling them with tales of his adventures.
DNT - Blah!

'Who can say when we will all be once again together, [placeholder]? Each of us has business elsewhere: some in the north, some here in the south. It would have been a shame not to mark the occasion. Is that so unusual? We all feel a kinship with each other, borne of our shared duty; it is strange to me that we must now separate.

'Lothrandir wishes to return to Forochel, the land of the Snowmen, so I will travel with him part of the way with some others of the company. Techeron will reside once again in Evendim, but on the way we will pay a visit to Saeradan and learn the tale of his own return to Eriador with our fallen brothers. Idhrien and Langlas plan to stay for awhile at Esteldín with Mincham. Angwedh has not yet decided where he will travel, just that his road lies to the north. If he has a place in mind, he has not shared it with us; I think the wilderness calls to him.'

Radanir smirks at you.

'Do you know what calls to me? The food of the north-lands! The food at this feast is too richly-made, too covered in sauces, too soft, and there's too much of it. There isn't anything to sink your teeth into, [placeholder]. Give me the crusty bread and old cheese of the Forsaken Inn, a day's ride east of Bree... that is all I need.'
Prince Imrahil was given a message for you.

'The Grey Company rode from Eriador to aid the chieftain of the Dúnedain, and now many of us will return to our homes; but not all. We all have our own reasons, for the king has not set a bond upon us that we do not choose for ourselves.

'But there remains the question: what shall be done about the land that lies on Gondor's doorstep? Mordor lies there, the Black Land, and who knows what sorceries of the Witch-king may lurk within the Morgul Vale. I will help my king to combat these evils, and so too will Dagoras, and Faeron, and Mithrendan.

'Others of the Grey Company may decide to do the same... but they must choose for themselves. We have done what we intended, but I wager that some may discover they wish to do more. Gondor awaits an era of peace... but it will not arrive without we who are willing to fight for it.'
Prince Imrahil told you a wine steward working at the wedding-feast wanted you to meet with him downstairs.

The wine steward gave you some fine bottles of Gondor's finest to use as a peace offering with the 'rough sorts' gathering outside.\n\nYou have been tasked with leaving Merethrond by the front doors and confronting the group of rough sorts the wine steward described.

'I played my part as well as I could, [placeholder]! Were your friends able to surprise you?'

The wine steward glances at Thrymm Red-beard, whose long-winded description of past glories has shown no sign of cessation; indeed, he may have started anew.

'Perhaps you can go back upstairs and see if my services are needed? I am sure there must be a need for more wine... there simply must....'
The Grey Company has gathered to celebrate the wedding of their chieftain, and to honour the great deeds done on his behalf.

'I hope you are enjoying yourself, [placeholder]. I confess to you that much of tonight has passed by with dizzying speed, but it is a joyful motion and I would trade it for nothing else.\n\n'Might I ask a favour of you? Earlier I spoke with Faramir about a matter of some importance, and I am interested to learn if he has come to a decision. Would you speak with him and determine if this be so?'

'Thank you for rescuing me, [placeholder]. I intend no disrespect for any of the fine folk at my table, for they are all worthies of Gondor in their own ways... but some of them can be most tiring.\n\n'Come with me, my helpful friend. I see the hobbits with whom I spoke right over there.'

'What do you think, Pip? What would old Flourdumpling have to say about the courses on offer here? Oh yes, Merethien, I think this wedding-feast can stand quite comfortably alongside the very finest of Shire banquets!'

'[placeholder], it is my pleasure to introduce you to my wife Gilithel, and I believe you have already met our son Bergil. He was quite the trouble-maker in Minas Tirith, running through the lower tiers with his friends, and he has found new ways to cause mischief in Ithilien. But he is a good lad, and at his age I was much the same.\n\n'I must confess to you I did not think I would be welcomed back to the city for the King's wedding, but word was sent to Lord Faramir, and we could not refuse.'
DNT - Blah!
'DNT - Blah!'
You should return to the wedding-feast, which will likely soon be winding down.
'DNT - Blah!'
'The chieftain of the Dúnedain has his throne.'
The wine steward is being regaled with tales of Thrymm's heroics, and he wishes to speak with you.
'DNT - Blah!'
The wedding-feast continues into the night and you should speak with King Elessar before the festivities conclude.

'One of the wine stewards came by earlier, before our friend from Rohan launched into his... full-throated... tales of bravery. This steward asked if we would do him the kindness of delivering you to him if you chanced to come by our table.\n\n'He said he would be downstairs, [placeholder]. Now that I have executed this charge, perhaps I will learn what else my daughter would hear of the new king of Rohan, and why the speaking of his name brings such a blush to her cheeks....'
Listen to the conversation of Prince Faramir and Samwise Gamgee
Prince Faramir of Ithilien is at the head table in Merethrond.

'Ah, there you are, [placeholder]! I am pleased the Prince of Dol Amroth gave you my message, for it is urgent and I did not know where else I might turn. There is something of a problem, you see, and I need you to ensure it does not get any worse!

'Some rough sorts have gathered outside. I am afraid they might intend to disrupt the wedding-feast in some way. They were asking for you!

'Here, take these bottles of wine out to them. It could be that an offering of peace will send them happily on their way. And if not, well... your deeds are well-known, and such rough sorts as these may take one look at you and decide it would be best for them to go elsewhere!'
'My dear one does me a kindness, but I am more interested in this decision than is he.'
'Of whom do you speak?'
'You are most welcome here, son of Beorn.'
'There will always be such a place, son of Beorn, both for your father's heroism and your own.'
'Do not be fooled, [placeholder]!'
'It was Radanir's idea.'
A loud disturbance has caused a commotion on the western side of the feast-hall.
'The Grey Company fulfilled its oath, and so did you, [placeholder].'
Grimbeorn has arrived!
King Elessar wishes to speak with you.

'And so, with our horses refreshed, we crossed the Mering-stream and rode hard through the Beacon Hills. We were so close, but not yet close enough: we were beset by Orcs and Variags near Amon Dîn! We broke through the line of Variags, but they did not pursue us. I think now I know the reason: they knew the road ahead would be held against us!'

Thrymm pauses in his tale, seeming to see you for the first time.

'Oh, [placeholder], pull up a seat! I was just telling these fine folk of Gondor about some of my recent adventures!'
Merethien wants to know if Merry and Pippin are satisfied that the wedding-feast she has helped to prepare can compare with the banquets they described in the Shire.
'My goodness!'
Pippin wants to return to his own table for a bit, and wishes for you and Merry to follow him.
'I liked the ones shaped like trees and stars especially!'

'It is a pleasure to speak with you, my friend. I saw you earlier, when our Halfling friends ran by the table on their way to do some mischief... it was a spirited chase, and brought a smile to my lips; that has been rare enough in the days since... well, in the past few days.'

Faramir falls silent, and you take the opportunity to ask if he has considered the topic about which King Elessar inquired. Faramir studies you quietly.

'He told you not the subject of our discussion? He is more subtle than I expected, or perhaps it is the hand of his Queen that makes him so! Ah, [placeholder], you are a friend, so I will speak freely.

'The king knows that my heart has been captured by the Lady Éowyn of Rohan. She returned to the Riddermark in the company of her brother while they prepare for the funeral of Théoden, and while she has been gone my heart has been in darkness! Ever she occupies my thoughts, and I know I will never again feel happiness or joy while we are apart. I dare not hope she feels the same, and would not! For I would wish her no unhappiness.'
'So many cheeses!'
'Apples, pears, plums, and cherries!'
'Pies, pastries, creams, jellies, and honeyed almonds!'
'DNT - Blah!'
'Don't forget the mead!'
'We have spent enough time at the tables of the Rohirrim, Merry.'

'I expect Grimbeorn and his animals will enliven Merethrond for a time. Good! It will give us a brief respite from all this celebration!\n\n'Arwen and I would like to speak to you, [placeholder], in a more quiet setting. Let us find one.'
'Let's go back to my table. Come on, [placeholder]!'
'DNT - Blah!'
'Whoa! We can't cut through here, [placeholder]!'
Thrymm Red-beard has obtained a captive audience, and is regaling them with tales of his adventures.
A great commotion draws your attention to the west side of the feast-hall
'We shouldn't interrupt the dance! Follow me!'
'We made it!'

Merethien, the Master Foodmonger of Minas Tirith, has some questions for Merry and Pippin concerning what qualifies as a 'banquet' at their home, the distant Shire. Furthermore, she is pleased to have an excuse to leave Ioreth's chatter and Galathir's lecture behind her.
